   How Encryption Works
  The
incredible growth of the Internet brings tremendous possibilities to
change the way we live and work. But how secure is the Internet, and
when can you be sure that your personal information is not being viewed
by someone else? In this article, discover how encryption and
authentication systems work to keep information secure.  Learn more about how encryption works.
 
Also at HowStuffWorks
How Building Implosions Work - When a large building needs to be demolished, contractors
turn to implosion experts who carefully and safely bring down structures in
what can be quite a spectacle. Find out how building implosions work and watch
some buildings come down.

How E-Bombs Work - If detonated, an electromagnetic
bomb, or e-bomb, would destroy most machines within a certain radius
that use electricity, effectively setting a city or community back 200 years.
Learn how e-bombs work and about the potential consequences of an e-bomb
attack.

How Ozone Pollution Works - Ozone is unstable, highly reactive and toxic at low
concentrations. Yet the atmosphere's ozone layer is essential for protecting us
from ultraviolet radiation. Learn how ozone works and about avoiding and
reducing ozone pollution.

  This Week's Video

A waterjet uses high-powered streams of water to actually
cut through metal. In this video from HowStuffWorks, learn how water can cut
through steel and why waterjets are sometimes better than metal cutters.
 Learn more about how a waterjet works.
